column2: I think the design looks nice and it was well presented
column3: I think the strategy if easy to follow but I think it might be hard to know where the special characters go, and there are literally dozens of websites I visit which require a password. No way to just remember all those, no matter what strategy is followed.
column4: I think that it is interesting and would help people create stronger passwords which would be good for security overall. Personally for me, I usually create passwords which would be just as strong or stronger than if using this advice but I like the way in which it helps you come up with a password.
column5: very nice presentation of this design
column6: I think that the presentation of this design is good.
column7: The presentation is very good and it is very easy to understand the main content
column8: This was very interesting and something that I never thought of.  I wish I could access this somehow, so that if I was creating a new login or opening a new account I could use this so that I could create a password.  This is a very good idea.
column9: Overall the presentation is attractive and helpful. However I doubt how much it will encourage users to use the strategy mentioned in it.
column11: The format of the password engine was good.
column12: The design takes the creation step by step so it is easy to understand. It makes me feel dumb for not thinking of this before and using it.The only thing I would worry about is where I put the special symbols/numbers and which ones I used. I would need to come up with a way of remembering that.
column13: This is very useful for all.
column15: That was very clear and understandable. It used to make a strong password
column16: Private memory, thought of it, first letters, numbers and symbols, strong and memorable password.
column17: It is interesting and gets you involved. But it does make the text small and hard to see (I am doing this HIT on a 13 inch Macbook). I liked the method because it would make passwords much easier to remember.
column18: It is straight forward and to the point.  I like it.
column19: to based upon design and password hint.
column20: I think it is simple yet very informative. It is not overly complicated so that even someone inexperienced should understand the message. I like the way it is presented and I would not change anything about it.
column21: I liked the way it was informal and casual. It was clear and understandable.
column22: I'm pretty certain that it will help me create a strong password, but not a memorable one since it uses just the first letters. If I was reminded to think of a certain memory when logging in, then I would remember it easily.
